attributes.action: reconsider deportation of Pegah Emambakhsh a lesbian who will be in danger in Iran
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If returned to Iran she faces certain imprisonment and possibly stoning to death. Her crime in Iran is her sexual orientation – she was in a relationship with another woman.
Ms Emambakhsh escaped from Iran, claiming asylum after her partner was arrested, tortured and it is feared has been sentenced to death by stoning. Her father has also been arrested, tortured and interrogated about Pegah’s whereabouts, he has since been released.
According to Iranian Human Rights Campaigners over 4000 lesbians and gay men have been executed since the Ayatollahs came to power in 1979.
Other European countries (including Germany and Holland) have a moratorium on deporting gay people back to Iran.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
